previous.name: A Saṅgha of a Thousand Nuns

segments.en: Linked Discourses 55
2. A Thousand Nuns
12. The Brahmins
At Sāvatthī
“Mendicants, the brahmins advocate a practice called ‘get up and go’.
They encourage their disciples:

segments.pli: ‘ehi tvaṃ, ambho purisa, kālasseva uṭṭhāya pācīnamukho yāhi.
segments.en: ‘Please, good people, rising early you should face east and walk.

segments.pli: So tvaṃ mā sobbhaṃ parivajjehi, mā papātaṃ, mā khāṇuṃ, mā kaṇḍakaṭhānaṃ, mā candaniyaṃ, mā oḷigallaṃ.
segments.en: Do not avoid a pit, a cliff, a stump, thorny ground, a swamp, or a sewer.
You should await death in the place that you fall.

segments.pli: Evaṃ tvaṃ, ambho purisa, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissasī’ti.
segments.en: And when your body breaks up, after death, you’ll be reborn in a good place, a heaven realm.’

segments.pli: Taṃ kho panetaṃ, bhikkhave, brāhmaṇānaṃ bālagamanametaṃ mūḷhagamanametaṃ na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: But this practice of the brahmins is a foolish procedure, a stupid procedure. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, or extinguishment.

segments.pli: Ahañca kho, bhikkhave, ariyassa vinaye udayagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ paññāpemi;
segments.en: But in the training of the noble one I advocate a ‘get up and go’ practice

segments.pli: yā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: which does lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

segments.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, udayagāminī paṭipadā;
segments.en: And what is that ‘get up and go’ practice?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti;

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehi.
segments.en: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, bhikkhave, udayagāminī paṭipadā ekantanibbidāya … pe …
segments.en: This is that ‘get up and go’ practice
which does lead solely to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.”

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha contrasts a foolish brahmanical ritual called “going upwards” with the four factors of stream-entry.
